comment: He's a nice guy and will help you if you ask very difficult though unless your good at math! Smart man

He was such a nice guy... To me. If you ask him to repeat something or tell him you don't understand, he will get aggravated with you and raise his voice. He is a very smart man, just not very good at teaching. If this is the only class available, I would wait for the next semester. Unless you're great in math and this is just a filler class...

I hate this man.  He is impossible to understand, and God forbid you give a wrong answer because you will be called on all day. He's rude and has a temper.  Extremely impatient and loves to give quizzes literally 5 minutes before class is over. Also please don't ask for clarification because he will just start getting loud with you.

Be prepared for a thick foreign accent, lack of teaching skills and tools, and a final that is an order of magnitude higher in difficulty. The final took me from an A that I maintained through the entire semester down to a B

Takes a bit to get used to his accent. He's not too tough of a grader but can get frustrated with students especially if they ask a lot of questions. All lectures come straight from the book word for word and so do a lot of the problems on the tests, so they werent too bad. Homeworks are just packets of problems. Preferably take someone else

He is willing to help if you do ask for help but he can be a bit impatient and quite unclear. He goes by the examples in the book and his tests are hard. I would advise against taking his class because even though I found calculus I very easy, I pretty much taught myself the course material.

I am taking Calculus 1 again. I passed the first time with little problem, but after getting deeper into calculus based subjects, I realized that I spent most of the semester verbally grappling with this professor and spent little of it actually learning vital material. Saying that he has a temper is a serious understatement!

His accent is hard to understand, but if you are patient and sit in the front you will get used to it. His lectures go right along with the textbook. Make sure you read the textbook and do the assigned homework. His tests are his own problems based off of the examples in the text. Basically, if you do your work and study you'll do well.

His accent is very very difficult to understand. I'm two weeks into his calculus class and he doesn't make any sense. I passed the AP Exam and high school with flying colors and decided to retake calculus for a better foundation. Bad mistake taking his class. First his accent but also his attitude and lack of instructions on what to do for homework

It's very hard to understand what he is saying. His explanations are unclear, he gets upset when you don't understand something the first time, and when you ask questions. He gets defensive and argumentative when you try to talk to him. Would not recommend to any students.

Overall, I liked him as a teacher. His accent is really hard to get past at first, but once you move past that you're good. He generally makes himself available if you need help. All of your work will be on paper so if you learn best through online practice don't take him.
He is very difficult to understand and does not explain material well at all. I ended up just reading the book and trying to teach myself. I would highly recommend a different professor.
He was confusing, didn't understand what he was teaching, and got answers on his own tests wrong. I hired a private tutor halfway through the course and still got a D in the class.

Avoid this class if you want to keep your sanity. Extremely frustrating taking his test that are hand written. 40% of one of his test was based off questions he failed to emphasize the importance of. Oh and if you don't know an answer expect to be called on in class..

Very frustrating professor who doesn't know how to teach the material. Challenging to understand. Gets mad often. Blames the class for not studying when 90% of us fail his quiz. Best way to pass his class is to ignore what he says and read from the book.

Terrible professor who aims at frustrating the student. He graded my exam loudly in front of the class, not holding back any criticism towards my competency. He gets angry from questions, and has terrible English. Avoid at all cost.

I read his reviews on here and had friends tell me I shouldn't take him, but I work hard so I thought maybe I would be alright so I took his class. I was wrong! I'm a math person yet did not enjoy this class one bit. It's obvious he's great at math, just not good at teaching it. I personally won't be taking any other classes with him.

I love him as a person but he moves extremely fast. He cares deeply about his students doing well but doesnt always explain thoroughly. If youre good at math and love it, take him but if youre not you may want to find a teacher that will break things down more. O YEAH and he gets 90% of his quiz and test questions from his notes and book EXs.

Dr. Assad is an interesting fellow. His accent is a trouble at first but after the first one or two weeks it's no problem at all. If you put in the effort and prove it, he will help you out - if you don't, he'll gladly leave you in the dust.  The book is critical to success in this class! Overall, I'd take him again.

I do believe he wishes his student perform well, he just doesn't give them the tools to do.  Can't understand much of what he says, but does teach (read) directly from the book. Has a bit of a temper and often lashes out.  No formula sheet provided on final after he said that he would.  I tell everyone that will listen...do not tke this guy.

He is hard to understand at first, but he goes right along with the book. If you open the book and follow along he is much easier to understand. He cares about his students. The class was full when it started only about half the people finished. All the people that I talk with loved him and would take another class by him.
Once you can understand him and understand why he is the way he is...he is a good teacher he is just impatient.
